sn35.1:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn35.1:4.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn35.1:5.4: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with proper understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn35.1:5.18: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with proper understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn35.1:5.19: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
sn35.1:5.22: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn35.1:5.23: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
